heading: secretarial pool
subheading: can you type? take a little shorthand? know your way around a coffee maker? then you might consider junking your mba, packing up the truck, and heading out to silicon valley to begin your new career as a secretary. while the average secretary in the united states makes between us$25,000 and $35,000 a year, the california variety can rake in three times as much. according to michelle burke, president of executive counterparts, an executive and administrative staff training agency, there are secretaries in the valley earning up to $100,000 annually. this is secretaries' week. if you're a silicon valley exec, let your administrative assistant pick up the tab.
author: wired staff
